intro: Auriculardisia heterotricha, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically come in shades of purple, pink, and white. The plant features thick, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in its natural habitat. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements. The genus Auriculardisia is named for the ear-like (auricula) shape of its flowers.
